title: CRISPR array sequence detection
description: This feature specifically detects CRISPR arrays, especially CRISPR spacer sequences and repeat structures. The feature shows strong, localized activation spikes precisely at CRISPR elements as seen in section_5 (IDs 6-8) and section_7 (IDs 6-8, 11). The activation pattern typically appears as distinct spikes rather than continuous signals, suggesting sensitivity to the specific sequence characteristics of CRISPR arrays. CRISPR systems are bacterial adaptive immune mechanisms that provide defense against phages and mobile genetic elements, and this feature appears to be capturing their characteristic sequence patterns. The feature is consistent across examples where CRISPR elements are annotated and appears in both gamma-proteobacteria and other bacterial taxa, suggesting it detects a conserved structural property of CRISPR sequences rather than organism-specific patterns.
